intro: Biscutella longifolia subsp. austriaca, commonly known as the Austrian biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It is a perennial herb with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct ecological and morphological characteristics compared to other forms of Biscutella longifolia.
